alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Iberville; Livingston; Pointe Coupee; St. Helena; West Baton Rouge; West Feliciana (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 16 at 4:51PM CST until February 16 at 7:00PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... East Baton Rouge Parish in southeastern Louisiana... East Feliciana Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Northwestern Iberville Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Northwestern Livingston Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Southeastern Pointe Coupee Parish in southeastern Louisiana... St. Helena Parish in southeastern Louisiana... West Baton Rouge Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Southeastern West Feliciana Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Southwestern Amite County in southern Mississippi... * Until 700 PM CST. * At 451 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 4 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Baton Rouge, Zachary, Baker, Denham Springs, Port Allen, Jackson, Clinton, Greensburg, Addis, Brusly, Maringouin, Slaughter, Rosedale, Grosse Tete, Wilson, Norwood, Brownfields, Greenwell Spring, Merrydale and Pride. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 127 and 161. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 6. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 8. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Iberville; Livingston; Pointe Coupee; St. Helena; West Baton Rouge; West Feliciana
